page.title: 19The Colerne Donkey
page.content: Colerne has a legend known as The Colerne Donkey. It is supposed to be buried in Colerne church yard. The legend is about a parson and his pet donkey. The parson went on holiday and left the donkey with the sexton. While the parson was away the donkey fell ill and died. The sexton ordered the donkey to be buried. Unfortunatly the grave was not big enough and the hooves of the donkey stuck up through the ground. So the sexton told the villagers to polish the hooves of the donkey until they shone. When the parson returned the sexton told him what had happened to the donkey. The parson told the villagers to dig a wider grave so the donkey could lie on its side. The grave of the donkey is still in the church yard now, though it is an unmarked grave.
